page.title: 04HOUSING
page.content: The population of this area is growing -about a 10% increase between 1961 and 1981. Many of the people (33%) who are moving into the area are young (15-29). Our survey showed that people buying their first home had difficulty in afforing houses. Many start by buying or renting flats. Because new housing is not a priority, no rapid growth is planned by the council. One major problem that worried people was the shortage of rented accomodation. The sale of council houses, cut-backs in building and the Green Belt policy have stopped any expansion. It is estimated that about 10% of the working population commutes to London. Several parts of the area are dominated by large impressive commuter suburbs. The village of Bidborough is made up of large detached houses some of which cost well over #100,000.
